message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC

The paper deals with a problem in cryptography (communicating without revealing information to an eavesdropper), which falls under the category of "cs.CR" (Cryptography and Security). The solution proposed involves finite vector spaces and colourings of lines, which are topics in information theory ("cs.IT") and discrete mathematics ("cs.DM"). The problem also involves drawing cards from a deck, which can be seen as a combinatorial problem ("cs.DS"). Finally, the solution involves a protocol for communication, which can be seen as a topic in computer networks ("cs.CC").
